reviews.review_msg: If you're a good writer, 309 is an incredibly easy class and he's easy to please.

Dasha is nice, funny, genuinely wants to help you learn, quickly responds to emails, and uploads stuff on time (some profs do not). Her asynchronous video lectures are easy to understand with lots of examples and visuals. They can be long though. Be sure to start reviewing for exams early, take notes on lecture slides, and keep up with weekly hw.

Dasha's lectures were really clear. Long, but engaging. Participation in lecture and online discussion is important - eay marks. Midterms were writing essays, but were well-structured. Final paper is a lit review that is broken down into components. Would definitely recommend Dasha as a prof! Super accessible! Hard class though! Get ready to WRITE

Racist but if that doesn't matter to you. she missed much of our class time going to conferences or sick but wouldn't cut students who miss class for similar reasons any slack.Asks for anonymous feedback but wouldn't take any into consideration. lots of work,( didn't mind it) but if you think you'll get sick or go through any hardship dont take it.

WARNING: The last test had an undiclosed segment that was different from the material discussed in class and textbook; 
Doesn't seem to care much. The pre-recorded lectures were of poor audio quality. The in-person lectures were long-winded; Likes to go on tangents whenever students ask simple questions, as if not sure of the answer herself.

The course content was very interesting; however, there was too much homework to be able to enjoy the topics. There are discussion posts for all 13 chapters, about 6 participation assignments per week, 4 tests, and a 12 page paper. The grading was very harsh and so much work. I would avoid this class if you can or take it during a lighter semester.

Subject matter very interesting, and instructor is very knowledgeable on the topic. Crazy workload for one course, though. Each week there are multiple, not difficult, but quite time-consuming assignments to complete. She also has her own grading scale (60% is a pass not 50%) which is.. extremely irritating considering my 79% is now a C+ not a B.

Very interesting material but so much work even for a W course. She sets up two 30 min lectures a week which is a waste of time frankly speaking. Most of the time she is just explaining how exam procedures are going to be conducted or what we are suppose to do for assignments and not the material itself.

Hilgendorf gives out extra homework all the time. She assigned us an extra 2 page paper between when our first and second drafts of our final paper were due. She bases her exams heavily on the textbook and doesn't provide any notes. Her grading criteria is not clear and she doesn't often explain what is expected of each assignment.

Approachable prof who is very passionate about her subject. Really makes sure her students understand the concepts. Only flaw is she treats her class as if it is the only one students are taking and has a tendency to add additional homework assignments at the last minute. Attendance is worth 10% so don't take this class with her if you tend to skip
